title: Data Source Integration Guide - FREE APIs
code: library(tradeio) library(tradefeatures) library(tradeengine) library(tradeviz) library(tradedash)  # 1. Fetch real data (choose your source) data <- fetch_yahoo("AAPL", from = "2023-01-01") # OR with Alpha Vantage for intraday: # Sys.setenv(ALPHA_VANTAGE_KEY = "your_key") # data <- fetch_alpha_vantage("AAPL", interval = "5min")  # 2. Add indicators data <- data %>%   add_sma(20) %>%   add_sma(50) %>%   add_rsi(14)  # 3. Create and backtest strategy strategy <- create_strategy(   entry = function(d) d$sma_20 > d$sma_50 & d$rsi_14 < 70,   exit = function(d) d$sma_20 < d$sma_50 | d$rsi_14 > 80 )  results <- backtest(strategy, data, initial_capital = 100000)  # 4. Visualize results plot_equity_curve(results) plot_drawdown(results)  # 5. Launch dashboard with real data launch_dashboard()

title: Data Source Integration Guide - FREE APIs
text: Limits: - ~2000 requests per hour - strict per-minute limit Best Practices: - ‚úÖ Fetch multiple symbols - ‚úÖ Cache data locally - ‚úÖ Use reasonable time ranges - ‚ùå Don‚Äôt fetch every second

title: Data Source Integration Guide - FREE APIs
text: Limits: - 5 API calls per minute - 500 API calls per day Best Practices: - ‚úÖ Fetch -hours possible - ‚úÖ Cache data aggressively - ‚úÖ Use outputsize="compact" possible - ‚úÖ package adds 12-second delays automatically - ‚ùå Don‚Äôt fetch symbols loop without delays Example caching:
code: library(memoise) library(tradeio)  # Create cached version fetch_cached <- memoise(   fetch_yahoo,   cache = cachem::cache_disk("~/.tradeio_cache") )  # First call: fetches from Yahoo data <- fetch_cached("AAPL", from = "2024-01-01")  # Subsequent calls: uses cache (instant!) data <- fetch_cached("AAPL", from = "2024-01-01")

code: library(tradeio) library(tradefeatures) library(tradeengine) library(tradeviz)  # Create session with live data session <- fetch_yahoo("AAPL", from = "2023-01-01") %>%   trading_session(     name = "AAPL Strategy",     description = "SMA crossover with RSI filter"   ) %>%   add_features(     sma_20 = add_sma(20),     sma_50 = add_sma(50),     rsi = add_rsi(14)   ) %>%   add_strategy(     entry = sma_20 > sma_50 & rsi < 70,     exit = sma_20 < sma_50 | rsi > 80   ) %>%   run_backtest(initial_capital = 100000)  # See everything print(session)       # Verbose output with all info summary(session)     # Detailed statistics  # Visualize plot(session)                    # Equity curve plot(session, type = "drawdown") # Drawdown plot(session, type = "all")      # All charts  # Launch dashboard dashboard(session)

title: Quick Guide: Switching Between Data Sources
text: ‚úÖ need daily data (OHLC day) ‚úÖ want zero setup (API key) ‚úÖ ‚Äôre long-term analysis (weeks, months, years) ‚úÖ ‚Äôre backtesting daily strategies ‚úÖ need 20+ years historical data ‚úÖ want unlimited requests (fair use) Examples: - Long-term trend analysis - Daily SMA crossover strategies - Multi-year backtests - Portfolio rebalancing strategies

title: Quick Guide: Switching Between Data Sources
text: ‚úÖ need intraday data (1min, 5min, 15min, 30min, 60min) ‚úÖ ‚Äôre day trading analysis ‚úÖ want backtest intraday strategies ‚úÖ need higher frequency data ‚úÖ ‚Äôre okay 5 calls/minute limit Examples: - Day trading strategies - 5-minute scalping strategies - Intraday momentum analysis - High-frequency pattern detection

what: Example 1: Yahoo Finance for Daily Strategy
title: Quick Guide: Switching Between Data Sources
code: library(tradeio) library(tradeengine) library(tradefeatures)  # Fetch daily data (no API key needed) data <- fetch_yahoo("AAPL", from = "2023-01-01")  # Add daily indicators data <- data %>%   add_sma(20) %>%   add_sma(50)  # Daily strategy strategy <- create_strategy(   entry = function(d) d$sma_20 > d$sma_50 )  # Backtest results <- backtest(strategy, data, initial_capital = 100000)

what: Example 2: Alpha Vantage for Intraday Strategy
title: Quick Guide: Switching Between Data Sources
code: library(tradeio) library(tradeengine)  # Set API key Sys.setenv(ALPHA_VANTAGE_KEY = "your_key_here")  # Fetch 5-minute intraday data data <- fetch_alpha_vantage("AAPL", interval = "5min")  # 5-minute strategy strategy <- create_strategy(   entry = function(d) {     # Enter on breakout     d$close > d$high_5min_ago   } )  # Backtest intraday results <- backtest(strategy, data)

title: Quick Guide: Switching Between Data Sources
code: library(tradeio) library(dplyr)  # Fetch from Yahoo (daily) yahoo_data <- fetch_yahoo("AAPL", from = "2024-01-01")  # Fetch from Alpha Vantage (daily) Sys.setenv(ALPHA_VANTAGE_KEY = "your_key") alpha_data <- fetch_alpha_vantage("AAPL")  # Compare nrow(yahoo_data)  # More historical data nrow(alpha_data)  # Recent data  # Both have same structure! colnames(yahoo_data) colnames(alpha_data) # Both: symbol, datetime, open, high, low, close, volume, adjusted

title: Quick Guide: Switching Between Data Sources
code: library(memoise)  # Cache Yahoo Finance calls fetch_yahoo_cached <- memoise(   fetch_yahoo,   cache = cachem::cache_disk("~/.cache/yahoo") )  # First call: fetches from API data <- fetch_yahoo_cached("AAPL", from = "2024-01-01")  # Second call: instant from cache! data <- fetch_yahoo_cached("AAPL", from = "2024-01-01")

text: ‚úÖ Stocks - US international stocks - Examples: AAPL, MSFT, GOOGL, TSLA, etc. ‚úÖ ETFs - major ETFs - Examples: SPY, QQQ, IWM, GLD, TLT ‚úÖ Indices - Major market indices - Examples: ^GSPC (S&P 500), ^DJI (Dow), ^IXIC (NASDAQ) ‚úÖ Cryptocurrencies - Major crypto pairs - Examples: BTC-USD, ETH-USD, DOGE-USD ‚úÖ Forex - Currency pairs - Examples: EURUSD=X, GBPUSD=X ‚úÖ Commodities - Futures contracts - Examples: GC=F (Gold), CL=F (Oil)

title: Using Real Market Data in TradeDash

title: Using Real Market Data in TradeDash
text: real-time tick data (15-20 minute delay) order book / Level 2 data Rate limit: ~2000 requests/hour Best : Daily trading, backtesting, portfolio tracking

Launch dashboard with results launch_dashboard()

title: üöÄ TradingVerse Unified Workflow System
text: Previously, using TradingVerse required manually coordinating multiple packages: - Fetch data tradeio - Add indicators tradefeatures - Build strategy tradeengine - Backtest tradeengine - Visualize tradeviz - Dashboard tradedash worked, lacked consolidation visibility.

title: üöÄ TradingVerse Unified Workflow System
text: created unified workflow system consolidates everything single, verbose, organized object.

title: üöÄ TradingVerse Unified Workflow System
text: ‚úÖ VERBOSE - print(session) shows exactly every step ‚úÖ ORGANIZED - components one object (data, features, strategy, results) ‚úÖ REPRODUCIBLE - Session contains complete history reproducibility ‚úÖ EASY VISUALIZATION - plot(session) handles charting logic ‚úÖ CLEAN SYNTAX - Chain operations %>% build step--step ‚úÖ DASHBOARD READY - dashboard(session) launches pre-configured interface ‚úÖ INSPECTABLE - Access component directly (session$data, session$stats) ‚úÖ SAVEABLE - Save entire session RDS later analysis

title: üöÄ TradingVerse Unified Workflow System
code: library(tradeio)       # Data fetching library(tradefeatures) # Technical indicators library(tradeengine)   # Strategy & backtesting (includes trading_session) library(tradeviz)      # Visualization library(tradedash)     # Dashboard  # Create complete trading session in one pipeline session <- fetch_yahoo("AAPL", from = "2023-01-01") %>%   trading_session(     name = "AAPL SMA Crossover",     description = "Testing 20/50 SMA crossover with RSI filter"   ) %>%   add_features(     sma_20 = add_sma(20),     sma_50 = add_sma(50),     rsi = add_rsi(14)   ) %>%   add_strategy(     entry = sma_20 > sma_50 & rsi < 70,     exit = sma_20 < sma_50 | rsi > 80,     name = "SMA_Crossover_RSI"   ) %>%   run_backtest(initial_capital = 100000)  # ONE PRINT SHOWS EVERYTHING! print(session)

title: üöÄ TradingVerse Unified Workflow System
code: plot(session)                    # Default: equity curve plot(session, type = "drawdown") # Drawdown analysis plot(session, type = "returns")  # Returns distribution plot(session, type = "trades")   # Trade markers on chart

title: üöÄ TradingVerse Unified Workflow System

title: üöÄ TradingVerse Unified Workflow System
code: # Step 1: Create session data <- fetch_yahoo("MSFT", from = "2023-01-01") session <- trading_session(data, name = "MSFT Test") print(session)  # See initial state  # Step 2: Add features session <- add_features(session,    ema_12 = add_ema(12),   ema_26 = add_ema(26) ) print(session)  # See features added  # Step 3: Add strategy session <- add_strategy(session,   entry = ema_12 > ema_26,   exit = ema_12 < ema_26 ) print(session)  # See strategy defined  # Step 4: Run backtest session <- run_backtest(session, initial_capital = 50000) print(session)  # See results!

title: üöÄ TradingVerse Unified Workflow System
text: Available feature functions tradefeatures: - add_sma(n) - Simple Moving Average - add_ema(n) - Exponential Moving Average - add_rsi(n) - Relative Strength Index - add_macd() - MACD indicator - add_bbands(n, sd) - Bollinger Bands - add_atr(n) - Average True Range - add_adx(n) - ADX indicator - many ‚Ä¶
code: session <- add_features(session,   feature_name = feature_function(...),   ... )

code: # Traditional approach still works data <- fetch_yahoo("AAPL") data <- add_sma(data, 20) data <- add_strategy(data, entry_rules = close > sma_20) results <- backtest(data, initial_capital = 100000)  # Convert to session for better organization session <- trading_session(data, name = "AAPL Traditional") session$backtest <- results print(session) plot(session)
